abstract_summ: The present work develops an accurate prediction model of the COVID-19 pandemic, capable not only of fitting data with a high regression coefficient but also to predict the overall infections and the infection peak day as well.The projections are intended to provide a base/ action plan for the socio-economic counter measures to alleviate nCOVID-19.In this paper a modified mathematical model based on the SIR model used which can predict the spreading of the corona virus disease (COVID-19) and its effects on people in the days ahead.The model predicts the approximate number of total infections at the end of the outbreak.Numerical simulations of the model show that if at least 55% of the population comply with the social distancing regulation with about 55% of the population effectively making use of face masks while in public, the disease will eventually die out in the population and that, if we can step up the case detection rate for symptomatic individuals to about 0.8 per day, with about 55% of the population complying with the social distancing regulations, it will lead to a great decrease in the incidence (and prevalence) of COVID-19.COVID-19 is caused by a novel coronavirus and has played havoc on many countries across the globe.The paper formulates and solves the problem of identification of unknown parameters of mathematical models of the spread of COVID-19 coronavirus infection, based on SEIR type models, based on additional information about the number of detected cases, mortality, self-isolation coefficient and tests performed for the Moscow city and the Novosibirsk Region from 03.23.2020.
title_summ: Risk Assessment of nCOVID-19 Pandemic In India: A Mathematical Model And SimulationMathematical Modeling of Coronavirus Reproduction Rate with Policy and Behavioral EffectsSimulation of COVID-19 Incubation Period and the Effect of Probability Distribution Functionon Model Training Using MIMANSAA Predictive Model for the Evolution of COVID-19Methodology for Modelling the new COVID-19 Pandemic Spread and Implementation to European CountriesMathematical Modeling of the Spread of COVID-19 in Moscow and Russian RegionsMathematical modeling and prediction of COVID-19 in Moscow city and Novosibirsk regionModeling the Control of COVID-19: Impact of Policy Interventions and Meteorological FactorsGlobal analysis of the COVID-19 pandemic using simple epidemiological modelsAnalysis of a mathematical model for COVID-19 population dynamics in Lagos, NigeriaModeling and prediction of COVID-19 pandemic using Gaussian mixture modelA Predictive Model for the Evolution of COVID-19An Efficient COVID-19 Prediction Model Validated with the Cases of China, Italy and Spain: Total or Partial Lockdowns?Prediction of COVID-19 transmission dynamics using a mathematical model considering behavior changes.
title_abstract_phrases: Numerical simulations of the model show that if at least 55% of the population comply with the social distancing regulation with about 55% of the population effectively making use of face masks while in public, the disease will eventually die out in the population and that, if we can step up the case detection rate for symptomatic individuals to about 0.8 per day, with about 55% of the population complying with the social distancing regulations, it will lead to a great decrease in the incidence (and prevalence) of COVID-19.Modeling and prediction of COVID-19 pandemic using Gaussian mixture modelCOVID-19 is caused by a novel coronavirus and has played havoc on many countries across the globe.Total or Partial Lockdowns?The present work develops an accurate prediction model of the COVID-19 pandemic, capable not only of fitting data with a high regression coefficient but also to predict the overall infections and the infection peak day as well.The projections are intended to provide a base/ action plan for the socio-economic counter measures to alleviate nCOVID-19.Mathematical Modeling of Coronavirus Reproduction Rate with Policy and Behavioral EffectsIn this paper a modified mathematical model based on the SIR model used which can predict the spreading of the corona virus disease (COVID-19) and its effects on people in the days ahead.A Predictive Model for the Evolution of COVID-19We predict the evolution of the COVID-19 pandemic in several countries using a logistic model.Mathematical modeling and prediction of COVID-19 in Moscow city and Novosibirsk regionThe paper formulates and solves the problem of identification of unknown parameters of mathematical models of the spread of COVID-19 coronavirus infection, based on SEIR type models, based on additional information about the number of detected cases, mortality, self-isolation coefficient and tests performed for the Moscow city and the Novosibirsk Region from 03.23.2020.
